body.name: CAPERAVE 15.6'' Portable Monitor Touchscreen, FHD IPS Touch Screen with Tempered Glass, Travel Monitor with Kickstand & Speaker, HDMI USB C External Monitor for Laptop Phone Computer Xbox Switch PS4/5
features: Make Your Devices Touch-enabled: This portable monitor features a 10-point capacitive touch. It is compatible with both Windows and macOS systems, allowing you to add touch functionality to your laptop, including Macbook, by simply connecting it via the Type-C interface. MUST NOTE: For Type-C 3.1 DP ALT-MODE or Thunderbolt 3/4 ports, use USB-C to USB-C cable for power, video, and touch. Use HDMI+USB-C for devices without these ports. No extra drivers required.

FHD Portable Monitor: The portable monitor features a 15.6-inch touchscreen with a Full HD resolution of 1920x1080. Its advanced IPS display offers a wide viewing angle of 178°, delivering accurate and vibrant colors that are perfect for gaming and watching videos. Moreover, the monitor is equipped with blue light reduction and flicker-free technology, ensuring a comfortable viewing experience even during long periods of use and reducing eye strain.

Lightweight and Portable Travel Monitor: Designed to be ultra-slim and easy to carry. Its compact size makes it a convenient option for people on the go who need a second screen. Whether you're a traveler, student, gamer, engineer, or anyone who needs a portable monitor, this device can easily fit into any suitcase or backpack. It's perfect for those who require a second screen while out and about.

Full Size HDMI and USB-C Ports: The monitor has Standard HDMI and USB-C ports, providing versatile connectivity options. You can connect it to a variety of devices, including laptops, desktops, gaming consoles, and mobile phones.

Built-in Kickstand and Speakers: The CAPERAVE Portable Monitor has a built-in kickstand that allows you to easily prop it up at different angles, making it comfortable to use while sitting or standing. Additionally, it features built-in speakers that deliver clear and immersive audio, enhancing your multimedia experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good portable touch screen monitor with one big issue with Mac OS X
reviews.reviewText: Pretty solid monitor, no real issues that are its fault other than hollow sounding speakers which I expected. I don't think I've had any external monitor with speakers anywhere near good, ever so not really counting that against it. Stand is pretty solid, and unless you're being somewhat forceful with your taps up at the top of the screen it's stable.Mainly posting this review in case someone else hopes to use this a real touch screen in OS X. Unfortunately Apple removed true touch screen support to force people further into their ecosystem to push iPads and Sidecar. This monitor acts like a touchpad in OS X, meaning if the cursor is on your other monitor and you touch the touch screen it will register as a click at the mouse's position on the other monitor. It will not interact with anything on the touch screen until the mouse cursor has been moved to it...which you can do from the touch screen, but you'll highlight/select everything it can on the way over since it counts as a click+hold. Not the fault of the monitor at all, just typical Apple shenanigans.Fortunately, this isn't my main use case for this monitor. I'm waiting on a Samsung s24 Ultra to show up so I can use this monitor with their Dex platform. I'd like to try to use the phone and this screen while working remotely out of my van to do web development and not worry about $3k laptop getting stolen when I'm not around. I'll update this review once I have more experience with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good.
reviews.reviewText: Very positively surprised upon receiving the monitor.Packaged nicely, feels very high quality, comes with all the cables needed, including a usb c to usb c that supports video output(which is needed if you want to use the touchscreen).Other positives include a full size hdmi port, a sleeve for storage and 2 year warranty.From what I can tell after using it for a few hours, the display quality is good and so is the touchscreen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love how slim this is, it's slimmer that my tablet. And it's a featherweight, but the screen works great. It comes with a cover which is really nice!I wanted something super light so when I travel and if I need to remote work I have 2 screens like I do at home - so this works really great. It also connects to my phone and duplicates and extends my phone screen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought 2 using on surface book 2 and Dell laptop Great purchases
reviews.reviewText: Got one for my wifes surface and one for.So far really good. picture, sound, touch all good. Good connection options. Good usb extra plug.All pros really.i do wish it was a tad brighter but still good. Also if you unplug the power cord, even if not needed, it requires you to re plug in the video usbc so a little annoying.but great deal at Christmas

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My HP windows laptop only works with the top usb c port which is marked as power. A Lenovo laptop and Macbook air both work with both ports and a single cable. Im pretty sure the ports are labeled wrong. For pass thru power to the laptop, the power cord needs to be plugged into the bottom port and laptop into the top. Even though the top port is labeled with a power plug. But it works, just reverse the labels. It works with an iphone 15 as long as a power cord is also connected to montior. The power cord wasn't necessary to use phone with my previous monitor but as long as it can still be done for watching movies while traveling.I like the screen. I like the kickstand. I like the buttons for the menus much better than those scroll wheels used for the menu navigation that most of the competing monitors have.I'm pretty sure the sleeve it came with was meant for a 15.6 "16:9 screen and not a 16" 16:10. Its a really tight fit and I will probably not use it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed.
reviews.reviewText: I work from home and wanted a light, compact 2nd monitor that wouldn't take up a lot of space when I travel. This was perfect. It does need to be plugged into it's power source or it will drain your laptop battery. It works. It'd does what it's supposed to. Plug and play.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great additional laptop monitor for travelers
reviews.reviewText: I travel often and purchased the Caperave 14.0" to use as a second monitor with my laptop. It's slim lightweight profile is hardly noticeable in my backpack and the display resolution is actually slightly better than my laptop's display. A co-worker decided to purchase the same monitor after seeing my dual set up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
